name: Turn to Frog
text: Until end of turn, target creature loses all abilities and becomes a blue Frog with base power and toughness 1/1.

editions.flavor: "Ribbit."
"Ribbit."
"Ribbit."
"Ribbit."

name: Turn to Mist
text: Exile target creature. Return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.

editions.flavor:
"Did you expect me to dodge? How quaint."
—Olka, mistmeadow witch

name: Turn to Slag
text: Turn to Slag deals 5 damage to target creature. Destroy all Equipment attached to that creature.

editions.flavor:

"If it wasn't a blackened, stinking, melted abomination before, it certainly is now."

name: Turri Island
text:
Creature spells cost {2} less to cast.
Whenever you roll {CHAOS}, reveal the top three cards of your library. Put all creature cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.

name: Turtleshell Changeling
text:
Changeling (This card is every creature type.)
{1}{U}: Switch Turtleshell Changeling's power and toughness until end of turn.

editions.flavor: A changeling involuntarily mimics the nearest being at hand, sometimes trading a borrowed shell for borrowed claws.

A band of Temur hunters, fleeing the Mardu, dug a hideout beneath such a creature as it slept. The horde found them and attacked. For three days the Temur held them at bay, and all the while the great beast slumbered.

text:
Outlast {G} ({G}, {T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on this creature. Outlast only as a sorcery.)

editions.flavor: One quiet word sets off the stampede.

editions.flavor:

name: Twilight Mire
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{B/G}, {T}: Add {B}{B}, {B}{G}, or {G}{G} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: As their roots soaked in a weak tea of bogwater and decay, the trees absorbed the essence of death into their living tissue.

Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)

name: Twin Bolt
text: Twin Bolt deals 2 damage divided as you choose among one or two target creatures and/or players.

editions.flavor: Kolaghan archers are trained in Dakla, the way of the bow. They utilize their dragonlord's lightning to strike their target, no matter how small, how fast, or how far away.
Kolaghan archers are trained in Dakla, the way of the bow. They utilize their dragonlord's lightning to strike their target, no matter how small, how fast, or how far away.

name: Twincast
text: Copy target instant or sorcery spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.

editions.flavor: Sometimes you have to search for inspiration, and sometimes it's right there in front of you.
Imitation is the most dangerous form of flattery.
Imitation is the most dangerous form of flattery.

name: Twinflame
text:
Strive — Twinflame costs {2}{R} more to cast for each target beyond the first.
Choose any number of target creatures you control. For each of them, create a token that's a copy of that creature. Those tokens have haste. Exile them at the beginning of the next end step.

name: Twinning Glass
text: {1}, {T}: You may cast a nonland card from your hand without paying its mana cost if it has the same name as a spell that was cast this turn.

editions.flavor: It takes two to craft a mirror: a practiced metalsmith to silver one side and her own hazy reflection to polish the other.

name: Twins of Maurer Estate
text: Madness {2}{B} (If you discard this card, discard it into exile. When you do, cast it for its madness cost or put it into your graveyard.)

editions.flavor:
"Children, where are your parents?"

text:

Enchant creature

name: Twisted Image
text:
Switch target creature's power and toughness until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"True strength is in the mind, for the body is too malleable a form."

text: Target player sacrifices a creature. You draw cards equal to that creature's power.

editions.flavor: In Otiev's mind, he ruled in favor of the accused. But in his courtroom he was only a spectator, watching his hand deliver the sign of death.

name: Twitch
text:
You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.

name: Tymaret, the Murder King

{1}{R}, Sacrifice another creature: Tymaret, the Murder King deals 2 damage to target player.

editions.flavor: His memories remained in the Underworld, but his cruelty crossed the Rivers with him.

text:
Lifelink

name: Typhoid Rats
text: Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

editions.flavor: Kidnappers caught in Havengul are given two choices: languish in prison or become rat catchers. The smart ones go to prison.
Kidnappers caught in Havengul are given two choices: languish in prison or become rat catchers. The smart ones go to prison.
When Tasigur sent his ambassadors to the Abzan outpost, the true envoys were not the naga but the infectious rats they carried with them.
Kidnappers caught in Havengul are given two choices: languish in prison or become rat catchers. The smart ones go to prison.

name: Typhoon
text: Typhoon deals damage to each opponent equal to the number of Islands that player controls.

editions.flavor: Fierce winds ripped across the tropical landscape. What they did not destroy with their fiery breath was washed away by torrential rain.

name: Tyrannize

editions.flavor:
"I can stab you where it hurts, or where you will feel absolutely nothing."

name: Tyrant's Choice
text: Will of the council — Starting with you, each player votes for death or torture. If death gets more votes, each opponent sacrifices a creature. If torture gets more votes or the vote is tied, each opponent loses 4 life.

Flying, haste
